title: Update: 4-year-old child shot Friday on Algonquin Parkway dies in hospital
content:
LOUISVILLE, Ky. (WDRB) -- LMPD says the 4-year-old girl shot Friday in the Park DuValle neighborhood died Saturday at Kosair Children's Hospital.
A release sent from police Sunday added that her injuries appeared to have come from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
Ilanye Price was pronounced dead at the hospital Saturday at 5:22 p.m., the coroner confirmed Sunday.
She died of a gunshot wound to the head.
The shooting took place at a home on Algonquin Parkway near 34th Street at about 7:17 p.m. on Friday.
Police blocked downtown streets so a parade of patrol cars and an ambulance could rush the girl to Kosair Children's Hospital.
"We're trying to find more definitive clues as to exactly what happened. There were other people inside of the home. We're not sure of the number. Obviously we're talking to those individuals again," LMPD spokesman Dwight Mitchell said on scene Friday.
"There is nothing to indicate that we're looking for anybody other than what was in the house," Mitchell said.
Police closed Algonquin Parkway between Cane Run Road and South 34th Street for several hours.
